demos.title: Basic Geography Match
demos.description: Simple radio mode matching - capitals to countries

correct.default: Excellent! You matched all countries correctly.

partial.default: Good effort, but some matches are incorrect.

incorrect.default: Review world capitals and try again.

model.prompt: Match each country with its capital city.
model.rationale: Paris is the capital of France, Tokyo is the capital of Japan, and Bras√≠lia is the capital of Brazil.
model.teacherInstructions: Students should demonstrate knowledge of world capitals. This is a basic geography assessment.

demos.title: Algebra Equations Match
demos.description: Match equations with their solutions using LaTeX math rendering

correct.default: Perfect! You solved all equations correctly.

incorrect.default: Review your algebra skills and try again.

model.prompt: Match each equation with its correct solution.
model.rationale:
For \(2x + 5 = 13\): subtract 5 from both sides to get \(2x = 8\), then divide by 2.

For \(x^2 - 9 = 0\): factor as \((x-3)(x+3) = 0\), so \(x = 3\) or \(x = -3\).

For \(\frac{x}{3} + 2 = 5\): subtract 2 to get \(\frac{x}{3} = 3\), then multiply by 3.
model.teacherInstructions: This assesses students' ability to solve linear and quadratic equations. Watch for common algebraic errors.

demos.title: Math Properties (Checkbox Mode)
demos.description: Multiple correct answers per row with partial scoring enabled

correct.default: Excellent! You correctly identified all mathematical properties.

partial.default: You're on the right track. Review the properties you missed.

incorrect.default: Review the definitions of mathematical properties.

model.prompt: Select all the properties that apply to each mathematical statement. Multiple properties may apply to the same statement.
model.rationale:
Commutative Property: The order of numbers can be changed without affecting the result (applies to addition and multiplication).

Associative Property: The grouping of numbers can be changed without affecting the result.

Distributive Property: Multiplication distributes over addition.
model.teacherInstructions: This question assesses understanding of fundamental algebraic properties. Partial credit is enabled to reward partial knowledge.

demos.title: Geometry Formulas Match
demos.description: Match geometric shapes with their area formulas using advanced math notation

correct.default: Outstanding! You know your geometry formulas.

incorrect.default: Review the area formulas for basic geometric shapes.

model.prompt:
Match each geometric shape with its correct area formula.

Note: \(r\) = radius, \(l\) = length, \(w\) = width, \(b\) = base, \(h\) = height, \(b_1\) and \(b_2\) = parallel bases
model.teacherInstructions: This assesses memorization and application of basic geometry area formulas. Ensure students understand what each variable represents.
